content:
BitmapSource Class

Definition

Represents a single, constant set of pixels at a certain size and resolution.

In this Article

[System.Windows.Localizability(System.Windows.LocalizationCategory.None, Readability=System.Windows.Readability.Unreadable)]
public abstract class BitmapSource : System.Windows.Media.ImageSource

Remarks

BitmapSource is the basic building block of the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) imaging pipeline, conceptually representing a single, constant set of pixels at a certain size and resolution. A BitmapSource could be a single frame in an image file that a decoder provides, or it could be the result of a transform that operates on a BitmapSource of its own. BitmapSource is not used to represent a multi-frame image or an animation.

Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) natively supports compression and decompression of bitmap (BMP), Graphics Interchange Format (GIF), Joint Photographics Experts Group (JPEG), Portable Network Graphics (PNG), and Tagged Image File Format (TIFF) images.

For bitmap decoding scenarios, BitmapSource uses automatic codec discovery, based on the installed codecs on the user's system.

The maximum height and width of an image is 2^16 pixels at 32 bits per channel * 4 channels. The maximum size of a BitmapSource is 2^32 bytes (64 gigabytes) and the maximum image size is four gigapixels. The minimum image size is 1x1.

Constructors

BitmapSource()

Initializes a new instance of the BitmapSource class.

protected BitmapSource ();

Properties

DpiX

Gets the horizontal dots per inch (dpi) of the image.

public virtual double DpiX { get; }
Value
Double

The horizontal dots per inch (dpi) of the image; that is, the dots per inch (dpi) along the x-axis.

DpiY

Gets the vertical dots per inch (dpi) of the image.

public virtual double DpiY { get; }
Value
Double

The vertical dots per inch (dpi) of the image; that is, the dots per inch (dpi) along the y-axis.

Format

Gets the native PixelFormat of the bitmap data.

public virtual System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat Format { get; }
Value
PixelFormat

The pixel format of the bitmap data.

Remarks

If the BitmapSource is directly readable, this is the format that the pixels will be in when they are read.

Height

Gets the height of the source bitmap in device-independent units (1/96th inch per unit).

public override double Height { get; }
Value
Double

The height of the bitmap in device-independent units (1/96th inch per unit).

IsDownloading

Gets a value that indicates whether the BitmapSource content is currently downloading.

public virtual bool IsDownloading { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the bitmap source is currently downloading; otherwise, false.

Metadata

Gets the metadata that is associated with this bitmap image.

public override System.Windows.Media.ImageMetadata Metadata { get; }
Value
ImageMetadata

The metadata that is associated with the bitmap image.

Palette

Gets the color palette of the bitmap, if one is specified.

public virtual System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalette Palette { get; }
Value
BitmapPalette

The color palette of the bitmap.

PixelHeight

Gets the height of the bitmap in pixels.

public virtual int PixelHeight { get; }
Value
Int32

The height of the bitmap in pixels.

PixelWidth

Gets the width of the bitmap in pixels.

public virtual int PixelWidth { get; }
Value
Int32

The width of the bitmap in pixels.

Width

Gets the width of the bitmap in device-independent units (1/96th inch per unit).

public override double Width { get; }
Value
Double

The width of the bitmap in device-independent units (1/96th inch per unit).

Methods

CheckIfSiteOfOrigin()

Checks whether the bitmap source content is from a known site of origin. This method is used to make sure that pixel copying operations are safe.

protected void CheckIfSiteOfOrigin ();

Remarks

This method only succeeds if it is passed a Uri that is from a site of origin or that is defined in a pack:. In all other conditions, this method will fail.

Clone()

Creates a modifiable clone of this BitmapSource, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

public System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource Clone ();
Returns
BitmapSource

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see Clone.

CloneCore(Freezable)

Makes this instance a deep copy of the specified BitmapSource. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

protected override void CloneCore (System.Windows.Freezable sourceFreezable);
sourceFreezable
Freezable

The BitmapSource to clone..

Remarks

This method is called by the Clone method and should not be called directly from your code, except when you call the base implementation while overriding this method. To create a modifiable copy of the current object, call Clone instead of calling this method directly.

For more information, see CloneCore.

CloneCurrentValue()

Creates a modifiable clone of this BitmapSource object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

public System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource CloneCurrentValue ();
Returns
BitmapSource

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see CloneCurrentValue.

CloneCurrentValueCore(Freezable)

Makes this instance a modifiable deep copy of the specified BitmapSource using current property values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

protected override void CloneCurrentValueCore (System.Windows.Freezable sourceFreezable);
sourceFreezable
Freezable

The BitmapSource to clone.

Remarks

This method is called by the CloneCurrentValue method and should not be called directly from your code, except when you call the base implementation while overriding this method. To create a modifiable copy of the current object, call CloneCurrentValue instead of calling this method directly.

For more information, see CloneCurrentValueCore.

CopyPixels(Array,Int32,Int32)

Copies the bitmap pixel data into an array of pixels with the specified stride, starting at the specified offset.

public virtual void CopyPixels (Array pixels, int stride, int offset);
pixels
Array

The destination array.

stride
Int32

The stride of the bitmap.

offset
Int32

The pixel location where copying starts.

CopyPixels(Int32Rect,Array,Int32,Int32)

Copies the bitmap pixel data within the specified rectangle into an array of pixels that has the specified stride starting at the specified offset.

public virtual void CopyPixels (System.Windows.Int32Rect sourceRect, Array pixels, int stride, int offset);
sourceRect
Int32Rect

The source rectangle to copy. An stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Empty* value specifies the entire bitmap.

pixels
Array

The destination array.

stride
Int32

The stride of the bitmap.

offset
Int32

The pixel location where copying begins.

Remarks

An empty sourceRect value (specified as all zeros) copies the entire bitmap.

CopyPixels(Int32Rect,IntPtr,Int32,Int32)

Copies the bitmap pixel data within the specified rectangle

public virtual void CopyPixels (System.Windows.Int32Rect sourceRect, IntPtr buffer, int bufferSize, int stride);
sourceRect
Int32Rect

The source rectangle to copy. An stem.Windows.Int32Rect.Empty* value specifies the entire bitmap.

buffer
IntPtr

A pointer to the buffer.

bufferSize
Int32

The size of the buffer.

stride
Int32

The stride of the bitmap.

Remarks

An empty sourceRect value (specified as all zeros) copies the entire bitmap.

Create(Int32,Int32,Double,Double,PixelFormat,BitmapPalette,Array,Int32)

Creates a new BitmapSource from an array of pixels.

public static System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource Create (int pixelWidth, int pixelHeight, double dpiX, double dpiY, System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat pixelFormat, System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalette palette, Array pixels, int stride);
pixelWidth
Int32

The width of the bitmap.

pixelHeight
Int32

The height of the bitmap.

dpiX
Double

The horizontal dots per inch (dpi) of the bitmap.

dpiY
Double

The vertical dots per inch (dpi) of the bitmap.

pixelFormat
PixelFormat

The pixel format of the bitmap.

palette
BitmapPalette

The palette of the bitmap.

pixels
Array

An array of bytes that represents the content of a bitmap image.

stride
Int32

The stride of the bitmap.

Returns
BitmapSource

The BitmapSource that is created from the specified array of pixels.

Create(Int32,Int32,Double,Double,PixelFormat,BitmapPalette,IntPtr,Int32,Int32)

Creates a new BitmapSource from an array of pixels that are stored in unmanaged memory.

public static System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource Create (int pixelWidth, int pixelHeight, double dpiX, double dpiY, System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat pixelFormat, System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalette palette, IntPtr buffer, int bufferSize, int stride);
pixelWidth
Int32

The width of the bitmap.

pixelHeight
Int32

The height of the bitmap.

dpiX
Double

The horizontal dots per inch (dpi) of the bitmap.

dpiY
Double

The vertical dots per inch (dpi) of the bitmap.

pixelFormat
PixelFormat

The pixel format of the bitmap.

palette
BitmapPalette

The palette of the bitmap.

buffer
IntPtr

A pointer to the buffer that contains the bitmap data in memory.

bufferSize
Int32

The size of the buffer.

stride
Int32

The stride of the bitmap.

Returns
BitmapSource

A BitmapSource that is created from the array of pixels in unmanaged memory.

FreezeCore(Boolean)

Makes an instance of BitmapSource or a derived class immutable.

protected override bool FreezeCore (bool isChecking);
isChecking
Boolean

true if this instance should actually freeze itself when this method is called; otherwise, false.

Returns
Boolean

If isChecking is true, this method returns true if this Animatable can be made unmodifiable, or false if it cannot be made unmodifiable.

If isChecking is false, this method returns true if the if this Animatable is now unmodifiable, or false if it cannot be made unmodifiable, with the side effect of having begun to change the frozen status of this object.

GetAsFrozenCore(Freezable)

Makes this instance a clone of the specified BitmapSource object.

protected override void GetAsFrozenCore (System.Windows.Freezable sourceFreezable);
sourceFreezable
Freezable

The BitmapSource object to clone and freeze.

Remarks

When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values. Note that if these properties contain resource references or data bindings, GetAsFrozen will fail when trying to freeze the object and will throw an InvalidOperationException.

This method is called by the GetAsFrozen method and should not be called directly from your code, except when calling the base implementation while overriding this method. To create a frozen copy of the current object, call GetAsFrozen instead of calling this method directly.

For more information, see GetAsFrozenCore.

GetCurrentValueAsFrozenCore(Freezable)

Makes this instance a frozen clone of the specified BitmapSource. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

protected override void GetCurrentValueAsFrozenCore (System.Windows.Freezable sourceFreezable);
sourceFreezable
Freezable

The BitmapSource to copy and freeze.

Remarks

This method is called by the GetCurrentValueAsFrozen method and should not be called directly from your code, except when calling the base implementation while overriding this method. To create a frozen copy of the current object, call GetCurrentValueAsFrozen instead of calling this method directly.

For more information see GetCurrentValueAsFrozenCore.

Events

DecodeFailed

Occurs when the image fails to load, due to a corrupt image header.

public virtual event EventHandler<System.Windows.Media.ExceptionEventArgs> DecodeFailed;

Remarks

DecodeFailed is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

XAML Text Usage

<object DecodeFailed="EventHandler" .../>

DownloadCompleted

Occurs when the bitmap content has been completely downloaded.

public virtual event EventHandler DownloadCompleted;

Remarks

This event may not be raised for all types of bitmap content.

DownloadFailed

Occurs when the bitmap content failed to download.

public virtual event EventHandler<System.Windows.Media.ExceptionEventArgs> DownloadFailed;

Remarks

This event may not be raised for all types of bitmap content.

XAML Text Usage

<object DownloadFailed="EventHandler" .../>

DownloadProgress

Occurs when the download progress of the bitmap content has changed.

public virtual event EventHandler<System.Windows.Media.Imaging.DownloadProgressEventArgs> DownloadProgress;

Remarks

This event may not be raised for all types of bitmap content.

XAML Text Usage

<object DownloadProgress="EventHandler" .../>
